intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium pictorum var. dasythrix, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and bright yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
